website_summaries.verdict: Its lightweight body makes it the perfect tablet to use on the go. If you opt for the model that includes the keyboard, you'll be ready for work or fun at a moment's notice, and you won't break your back by having it in your bag.
pros: The fast-charging mode can give you a solid 15 hours of use time
SmartThings capabilities allow you to control your lights, electronics, etc
in your home, all from your Galaxy tablet
156GB of memory allows you plenty of storage space for photos and videos
cons: Some users claimed the WiFi dropped when placed in landscape mode

customer_reviews.title: Crashed Device
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to complain about this defective product. After opening the box, it was noticed that the tablet screen was cracked near the charger connector and on the screen side. Then, I tried to charge the battery in order to test the device but it didn't work (The device didn't turn on). It is broken and defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless charger cord.
customer_reviews.text: Pros:I really like the tablet, mine works as intended. And is a great improvement over an older tab A 8in. Cons: However, the supplied cord is unreasonably short. I can't plug it in anywhere in my house and have the tabel sit on a surface other than the floor. It's not even compatible with my USB tower. The battery drains faster while charging than it does not plugged in. Samsung doesn't even have longer cords available for purchase. I'm very annoyed at risking the safety of my tablet because a proper charging cord in a longer length isn't available for it.
customer_reviews.author: GAWildKat

customer_reviews.title: Nice if it last
customer_reviews.text: This tablet froze on me after 3rd day. Not because it's hot in my place( Seattle area btw), when I hit the back from the screen it froze and tried to press power button it would turn off. Never had an experience with my Samsung tab 10.1
customer_reviews.author: The_13th

customer_reviews.title: Screen is responds  like a CAPACITIVE TOUCH SENSITIVITY
customer_reviews.text: I have two units of the Tab 5Se. Both of them has issues on touch sensitivity. Sometimes, I have to press the screen up to 5X for it to respond. This is PAINFUL! It's like the old capacitive screen technology. Not acceptable. The rest, is okay, including the sound. BOTTOM LINE. This is a piece of CRAP ! SIDE NOTE. I have two of the galaxy TAb S2 9.8" that did not have type of problem. But I wanted to replace it because of the screen size/ dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Spyro

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet to replace an aging and very worn original Galaxy Tab S. I am NOT disappointed. It's about the same size, is much faster and does what I need it to do. I mostly use it for email, social media apps and a few games. The S5e is lighter than the Tab S and the battery life is much better. I was concerned with the lack of an audio jack, but the S5e came with an adapter cable that allows me to use my old style ear buds without having to purchase a Bluetooth set. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SnoShu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tablet. Screen is drop dead gorgeous. Super light. Great sound from the 4 speakers. I have zero wifi issues. Been using it for 4 days now and no dropouts or dissconnects when holding the tablet on the lower left side. Could possibly be just a silly rumor set up by Apple loyalists who cant fathom Samsung making a superior/cheaper product. I definitely reccomend buying this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: jason scerri

customer_reviews.title: Wifi connection problem !!!
customer_reviews.text: So I was vey happy becouse weight and design is very nice, but when I checked wifi connection, tablet looses it when I have it in my hands !! :@ so shame of Samsung ! What can I do now ? Is it technical problem or should I wait some new sistem updates to fix that problem ?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What good is a touch screen tablet that barely responds to touch?
customer_reviews.text: I switched over to the S5E from an ipad pro, which was old and having issues. I didn't want to throw down the money for a new one and figured I'd give the samsung a chance, since I love my S10E. My mistake. The screen is awkwardly elongated, but is actually an amazing screen. The battery life isn't half bad. The issue is with the touch sensitivity and lag. Now that this tablet is 6 days outside of the return period, it's laggy in responding to touch and sometimes requires me to repeatedly poke at the screen to get it to register. Now I'm stuck with this tablet that I hate. I should have gone with the ipad.
customer_reviews.author: Audra B

customer_reviews.title: Might be good tablet but....
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, great screen, etc., but before the unit even fully synced or charged, it locked up. No single or collective set of the power button, volume button combination does anything. Returning ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: stan

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of that pin hole
customer_reviews.text: I would've given this tablet a 5 star rating because I love everything Samsung BUT after I jammed the memory release pin in the microphone hole I changed my mind. I need reading glasses, but I'm not blind. Whoever at Samsung thought it was a good idea to put the exact same size microphone hole 5/8" away from the tray release hole needs to be fired. I know I'm the idiot but still it' not a great design. Now my brand new tablet has one let microphone. This wouldn't have happened if the box came with a detailed manual. Instead you get a1 page quick guide in which NOWHERE did I see the word don't stab your microphone hole!!!
customer_reviews.author: Product Tester

customer_reviews.title: Great so far, no problems
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and screen is better than the Google Pixel C that this replaced, online videos , MLB TV, Plex and YouTube all play great. Setup was easy, 15 minutes, and you can actually migrate all your apps from your old android. I'm not sure about all the negative reviews, guess I'm lucky and got a good working new tablet. The reports about the wifi dropping is not entirely true, the signal drops by about 1 bar if you cover the left bottom corner, but the wifi stays connected.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: It's finally here!
customer_reviews.text: I recived my tablet today and so far, it's exactly what I wanted and expected. I'll update my review as I use the tablet. I've used a Lenovo, a kindle fire and other Samsung tablets. Pretty excited! Edit June 1: great tablet! I have not experienced some of the Wi-Fi issues that have been reported.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Richardson

customer_reviews.title: recieved with small cracks in corner of screen
customer_reviews.text: When we received this item it had what looked like a very small chip in the bottom left corner of the tablet. My wife was ready for a new tablet and as this was not a big deal we let it go. Now we have cracks along the bottom edge and across the bottom left corner of the tablet even though it has been in a case sense day one and never left the house. I would suggest people take a good look around before buying things like this on amazon. This is not my first high tech item to go bad but it will be the last I buy from a mail order.
customer_reviews.author: ret tech

customer_reviews.title: Kept crashing from the get-go
customer_reviews.text: Have had lots of Samsung phones, watches and tablets. Very disappointed that this one kept crashing, out of the box. Samsung tech support was useless, as usual. You are always better off searching for answers in product community forums. Unfortunately, no suggestions there helped with this Tab S5e
customer_reviews.author: Steve C.

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi is a major problem
customer_reviews.text: I love the form factor and build quality of this unit. Those alone would overcome the bloatware, which is significant and immutable. but the reason I would advise you against purchasing one of these is that the Wi-Fi is really quite poor. The issues are not limited to a particular location on the unit. The Wi-Fi is way below usable in many situations. I have tried it on more than a dozen networks and it is consistently weak and prone to drop offs.
customer_reviews.author: championshopper

customer_reviews.title: JUST BUY IT YOU WILL ❤ IT
customer_reviews.text: I ❤❤❤ THIS TABLET...BEEN WANTING IT EVERY SINCE IT CAME OUT...GREAT PREFORMANCE...BLUE LIGHT IS ON ON THIS PICTURE YOU SEE ON THE SCREEN...IT HAS VERY CLEAR PICTURE...AS FAR AS PEOPLE SAYING ABOUT THE WIFI PROBLEM I HAVE NOT HAD THAT PROBLEM AS FAR AS MY HANDS GETTING IN THE WAY OF THE WIFI ANTENNA OR WHATEVER YOU CALL IT...I GOT THE GOLD ONE AND NOW I GOT THE PHONE TO MATCH THE MYSTIC BRONZE NOTE 20...CAMERA IS GOOD ALSO...SCREEN AREA IS VERY CLEAR IN COLOR...
customer_reviews.author: MISS PISCES

customer_reviews.title: Thing of Beauty!
customer_reviews.text: I first got the S6 Lite for the S Pen, but realized I did not really need the pen. My Surface Pro is more than adequate. So, after after reading a few reviews S6 Lite vs S5e, I decided to return the S6 Lite in exchange for the S5e. Very good decision. This S5e is a "thing of beauty". Four speakers compared to the two of the S6 Lite, the screen resolution much better, its much lighter, processing speed faster. Huge difference. I am happy I made the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: WOULD DEF BUY AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: It was worth every penny. I have included a pic next to a legal pad for size comparison. Its sleek, gorgeous and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: I love the UI
customer_reviews.text: I own six Windows/Android devices, two of which are Samsung tablets (Tab A is the other) . I also tried-and-returned an Amazon tablet (didn't like the UI) and the Microsoft Go 2 (too heavy). I like the S5e user-interface for several reasons but there is one main reason: a choice of the desktop site instead of the app. For example, the Washington Post desktop site has a much better user interface than the Washington Post app. I haven't seen that option in any other tablet. This tablet is also thin and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: crimsonkng

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Did my research before purchasing and the tablet performs how I expected. My only complaint, which I was aware before purchase, is no native DNLA support. I love samsung entertainment products and have them throughout my home. Phones, TVs, tablets... (their washer/dryers are meh, but that's a story for another day.) They haven't had native DNLA since the Galaxy S5 (maybe s6, skipped that phone) which is just silly. Other than that, screen-awesome, operating system-awesome, speakers-awesome for a tablet. Easily customizable, great parental controls through making non-administrator profiles for the kids and lots of nice accessories it supports. It does everything and more for half the price compared to its Apple equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great device, even better when you replace the default OS with Lineage 17.1 (Android 10)
customer_reviews.text: Goodbye, Samsung bloatware...hello Android 10 thanks to Lineage 17. Warranty still active because you can do it without rooting, and if you ever need to return it or sell it, you can put the stock operating system back like nothing ever happened.
customer_reviews.author: A. McQuade

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE if you choose a warehouse option for this tablet. I believe the one I got wasn't inspected at all unless the damage occurred in shipping. I've never received a broke tablet before due to shipping, but it can surely happen. I feel like the inspection process might be lacking lately. There was a sticker on it saying it was inspected, but it seems it wasn't removed from the plastic. Upon removal, I found it to be destroyed, and a small glass shard got into my finger. Just let this be a warning if you're considering the cheaper option. I believe with Amazon being overwhelmed, warehouse inspections maybe pretty lackluster for now.
customer_reviews.author: Jermey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great product for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: I did not get the phone data version, rather only wifi, which is all I need. It is clear, easy to read the screen, easy to operate and has a great battery life as well. I purchased a mini-SD card to expand my memory. One huge piece of advice for everyone...do NOT forget your pass word. It is beyond hopeless to try to guess it. I was forced to do a factory reset which wiped everything clean and back to its original factory settings. I would also recommend one of those plastic/glass screen protectors as well as a solid protective case. I use an Otter Box for mine and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Schueller

customer_reviews.title: Hits the Spot
customer_reviews.text: This tablet basically fulfills every need I have for a mid-sized tablet. For the price v value you can't beat it. The symmetry and design aesthetic is spot on. The speakers and screen are amazing. The thinness and weight is lighter than a phone. I'm loving this tablet. And despite the landscape wifi covering issue, I have no problems since this is primarily used in portrait mode. This was the tablet I've been waiting for, granted, I don't use or like Samsung devices, and can't stand OneUI used on them, however this is an exception simply because it's such a clean looking devices, and the specs for the price are unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: David Paplia

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is fast!
customer_reviews.text: For years, I have been using Amazon Kindles. A few months ago, I "upgraded" to a Kindle Fire HD 8. I think this Kindle is way too underpowered. It is slower than my previous Kindle Fire. I had been forced to frequently reboot to get anything done. I decided I'd had enough of low-priced tablets. I searched for a tablet in the $400 range and settled on the Samsung S5e. All I can say is why didn't I buy this sooner? I can't see me ever going back to a Kindle. The price tag for this tablet is not cheap. Given the preformance, I feel the cost was money very well spent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this tablet. It freezes and restarts often when playing games like solitaire. Also has connection problems. This is the second one I purchased thinking I just got a bad one. I am waiting over a month for my refund from Samsung for the first tablet
customer_reviews.author: Geneva

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice table with sufficient memory. I hated the setup since the apps are hidden by default (why?) I actually had to go online on my PC (couldn't even find a browser app on the tablet) to find where the apps were hidden. Very frustrating. I don't like that there isn't a physical home button any more, some games hide the on screen one and to access it you end up wasting a shot or doing something you didn't want to inside the game. Overall though I am happy with the table, the screen is sensitive and the battery will last all day if using it hard.
customer_reviews.author: Diancatzdogz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful screen
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has a beautiful screen and is fast enough for my needs. I bought it mainly to watch Netflix, play some games and surf the internet. The lack of a headphone jack is a bummer and the audio adapter hanging off the bottom isn't great (doesn't sound like stereo with sound only thru one ear) but I knew that before I purchased. With bluetooth headphones connected I've been having no issues playing Knights of the Old Republic. I'm not sure if something more graphically challenging would be a problem. Got it on sale so well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Met11756

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet yet
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. Its excellent so far. I could have used my note 10+ to link with S5e to test Dex but will await the arrival of the Fintie keyboard case. For movies and music streaming and general communication, its as good as any tablet out there. People talk about processor speed. You have to really focus on the so called slow scene shift (and lose the thought on what you are watching) to see this as a disadvantage. We are talking milliseconds here. The tab is good, great screen and just plain works right.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Locsin

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for games, sound, good replacement for iPad
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it; uses the DEV feature with a USB-C to HDMI and this is his new laptop. It's better than my laptop in DEX mode; but I can't tell him that! He does his homework in Google docs, watches youtubes while he's doing homework; all the 9 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Reno G

customer_reviews.title: Great New tablet
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Samsung tablet with this one. It's a lot quicker with a better screen, a a bit larger. It is very thin, so I recommend you get a case of some sort. It does take a little getting used to because there is no "home" button on the front of the tablet. You drag it up from the bottom on screen. The internal speakers are very good, and you have no trouble hearing anything you are playing. Saw some negative comments about no headphone jack, but you actually have one with the adapter supplied in the box. A very nice tablet especially if you don't want to spend a fortune on an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crabb

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tablet for Anyone, Priced Right!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tablet. Great sharp vivid display. Plenty of space for digital storage. Plus can expand for more memory. I recommend this tablet over the cheaper ones and over the really expensive ones. I can't emphasize enough how great the display screen is. It also has a very responsive touchscreen. It's also on the thinner side. But that doesnt matter because i recommend a case with a stand. Fantastic Tablet if you're on the fence about getting a tablet. Great performance at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Roman

customer_reviews.title: Attena issue
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has an issue, if you place your hand over the top corner of the tablet the Wi-Fi signal drops drastically. I didn't think it would be that annoying, but after using my tablet for a while it is actually quite annoying losing signal based on how I hold my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't connect to WIFI
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this tablet because it would absolutely refuse to connect to my WIFI right out of the box. It's a shame because the screen and body is absolutely gorgeous but keep in mind this tablet has a history with WIFI problems, wheather it keeps disconnecting or just never connects at all to the WIFI. Would NOT recommend anyone to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tablet at an even better price.
customer_reviews.text: The price for this and what you receive for that price is incredible. Absolute beast for the price and the screen is terrific. Highly recommend over an iPad of the same value if you prefer android and the customization it allows.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Repeated WiFi Problems Regardless of Orientation
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't matter how I hold it. Wifi intermittently vanishes or becomes achingly slow. I check other mobile devices to make sure it isn't a route problem. It seems to get worse over time. Wish I never bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Evans Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love This Tablet
customer_reviews.text: The sound and screen quality just blew us away. A great tablet that proves "paper specs" are worthless. The chip set in this tablet works just fine and the speed is on par with anything in this class. You can actually watch a movie on this tiny screen and enjoy it. We shied away at first because of experiences with Samsung Galaxy phones (bloatware and Bixby) but this tablet has none of that. There is a silent "Bixby Page" but it is actually useful in this scenario. This outclassed my daughter's iPad so much that she purchased the Samsung Tab S5e for herself and handed down the iPad.
customer_reviews.author: John HuffTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: May not be new.
customer_reviews.text: After having this tablet for less than a month. It powered down and would not power back on. Contacted customer support and went through all the usual things to try. Nothing worked so Amazon refunded me and I just ordered another one just like it from same seller because it was a great tablet with a great picture and speed. Well looking at the box this am to get the return ready. I see the sticker on the side of the box says "used very good" Not a happy shopper. I thought I bought a new tablet. Be wary of this trick. The description says "new and used"
customer_reviews.author: e.j.w.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for my use
customer_reviews.text: I have a Galaxy Tab S3 as well and I wanted this to use for e-books, email and web browsing. I got it because of the good price and features. I didn't need the latest Chipset for speed, etc. It works great and is very responsive. I love the smaller bezels and the screen layout (dimensions). I haven't streamed any media yet but that should work just fine as well. I have never needed a stylus so for the money this is a great device. I really love it and recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Love

customer_reviews.title: Great features,  worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love the speed of this tablet. The camera takes much better photos than my last tablet. I love the way when you're watching a youtube vid, you can go to another site, and the vid continues to play in a smaller screen while you go to other websites. My last tablet didn't have that feature. I dont find the battery terribly long lasting..its not bad. All in all, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gildedmermaid

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet that I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've owned more than a half a dozen tablets. The first three were iPads. I was annoyed at having the limited storage space with the closed iPad system. This tablet has the best screen and with the 128 gbs of internal storage and the 512 expandable micro sd storage I may never need another tablet. I travel a lot and the ability to carry tons of GOT and movies is invaluable. The 6 gb of RAM makes this tablet incredibly fast. Overall, this is the best tablet that I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Bedenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: great tablet
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I've always had the A series tablets and they worked for a while but never seemed to preform well for games movies etc.. this is my first S Tab and I love it. The sound and screen are amazing. Battery is awesome as well.. I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hold! Needs a case.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture & sound is darn good for a tablet! I've only had it 24 hours and am still adjusting to it. It is so thin it definitely needs a case, it's very slippery & hard to hang onto, so be careful! Cases are hard to find. I'm waiting because I want a keyboard case which aren't available yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob & Tammie

customer_reviews.title: Revised Opinion
customer_reviews.text: The set up wizard was a challenge. I got stuck with the voice assistant when setting up and it was only by trial and error that I found out that you had to touch one icon or type each character once and then two times fast in succession. Touch screen commands were initially sluggish and erratic. Everything about it was slow. After the teething problems were solved, it behaved as I had hoped and I am glad to say now that I am pleased with it. The extra storage of 128 GB is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: pcbrennan

customer_reviews.title: was Perfect for drone flying
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Samsung tab S5e to use with a DJI Mavic air. I am was not disappointed at all. It worked great. But then came the first up date. there is and was all those samsung apps you dont really want at first you could disable them but now it is overloaded the 4gb of ram is only 500mb free when samsungs apps are running in the background. the seamless interface with dji go4 app has become shake. this is a nice tablet its large ram is overloaded and there is now a hint of been sluggish.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Media Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a must buy if you are only looking for a decent Samsung tablet for media consumption. You could always go for the cheaper Tab A 10.1 (2019) version (another great tablet). However, the speed and audio quality is better on the Tab S5E. Pros: 1) Excellent display 2) Excellent speakers 3) Light weight 4) Thin Bezels 5) Decent Cameras (for a tablet) Cons: 1) older Snapdragon CPU 2) base RAM is 4 GB 3) no headphone jack (joining the dongle life) 4) no active pen support 5) Samsung Dex support
customer_reviews.author: rawr

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Samsung tablet but it may be my last. My wife has an S2 and we can sit right next to each other and she will get a good signal and I will get a poor to no signal. I go to google play store and I have to reset to the original version on the tablet to be able to download anything. All other devices work fine when downloading. I think Samsung needs to do some upgrading and backtracking before they charge over $400.00 for it. I wouldn't buy until they make some changes.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Non responsive and Crappy "Touch Screen"
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen is faulty. This was supposed to be "NEW" tablet. I kept trying to set up the tablet with connect to Wi-fi but the touch screen acted like I was not typing. When it did display a letter it repeated it about 7 times. I grew frustrated and sent the tablet back. I spent too much money for that thing not to get through set up. I kept tapping on the touch screen and the screen would not display or react to my touch with or without a stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah M. Claiborne

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet, highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This may be one of the best purchases I've ever made. This is an amazing tablet at great price. It's worth every penny. The battery life is great, the screen quality and CPU speed are incredible. Whether I use it as a tablet or connect it with a keyboard + mouse, it always does the job well and beyond. I would highly recommend this device to anyone who's looking to buy an effective, reliable and cost-worthy tablet
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Bejar

customer_reviews.title: MISS LEADING ADD !
customer_reviews.text: Tell you that you can use as your phone BUT THEY DON`T TELL YOU THAT IT HAS TO BE SAMSUNG PHONE and not a Lower price one like e A10 no it has to be a high price one !!! So there miss leading the customer. and its loaded with a bunch of app that you can`t uninstall so that eating up half of your RAM the screen lags when you rotate it, bench marks not that great ! If your buying this your only paying for the NAME SAMSUNG better off buying nock off for a lot less ! you probably be more happy saving the money then shelling out for this one
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lesniak

customer_reviews.title: Androad tablets goes big time
customer_reviews.text: After years of faithful service, our Galaxy S2 8" tablets were getting a little grungy and slow. Initially I was bummed that the 8" size was no longer available. But the 10" size is really great. Picture quality and speed are tops, and paired with a Fintie keyboard case I can use it for work, too. This is a great tablet for reading, web surfing, emails, and general light computer use.
customer_reviews.author: JimmytheBike

customer_reviews.title: WiFi issues
customer_reviews.text: Landscape mode WiFi cuts in and out . Great battery life and display. USB c is nice too. I can not give more than two stars for a defective product from the factory. Very disappointed will be returning
customer_reviews.author: david mays

customer_reviews.title: I Love the Samsung S5e
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a great tablet for years, and I found it. It is responsive; the Internet speed is great, playback speed for online music and movies is wonderful and download speed is quick. The screen is clear and crisp. I could not be happier. I would buy again in a minute. Only downside is that you cannot download themes from the Samsung store.
customer_reviews.author: R. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Thin, light, quick with a very good screen
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an old slow tablet. This tablet is very quick with a very good screen. The documentation is a bit sparse and a first time tablet user would have a steeper learning curve. No problem for an experienced user. I researched tablets and couldn't stomach a $700+ price for the top of the line ones when you could buy a computer for the same money. Tablet is thin and light weight and I very highly recommend it as a mid price performer.
customer_reviews.author: IT Lifer

customer_reviews.title: Google and Android
customer_reviews.text: Though Google creates and updates Android, the most used OS in the world, this tablet does not allow for the installation of Google's Messages which I use to sync with Google Web Messages. That is very disappointing. I imagine the fault lies with Samsung who also adds numerous apps that I have no use for. The above complaints aside, the tablet is very nice and the screen looks excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Trevithick

customer_reviews.title: Died the next day
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for one day and then will not turn on. Nothing I did could get it to turn on or indicate it was charging. Samsung has innovative products but also has a history of quality and design issues. Too bad. Shopping, ordering then returning a defective product takes up so much time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died After 13 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Looked and performed beautifully...for a little over 3 months. Now it is as dead as a doorknob. Extremely disappointing. I've had a few Samsung products over the past 10 years and expected good quality for the higher than average price tag.
customer_reviews.author: K.L.

customer_reviews.title: Dead at 13 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased August, 2019. Lasted 13 months and then black screen. It appears the device was active as Google could "see" it in Find My Device and it was making alert sounds but had no display. Would not factory reset. I purchased extended warranty coverage so back it went. Until it died (WAY TOO SOON), I was very happy with the device: great display, reasonably fast, very light. I heartily recommend purchasing extended coverage!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Crisp clear bright display. Fast really works well. My only complaint is that at times I lose internet signal. I don't know if that's because I have a cover that covers the antenna. Otherwise a good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, screen and interface
customer_reviews.text: Love it, sound is amazing, the Dolby atomas coupled with 4 speakers makes for a very immersive sound expieriance for a tablet. It's no sonos speaker but for a tablet it's incredible. The screen resolution and color is perfect the amoled screen makes such a difference comming from standard screens. The brightness is great. Samsung DeX is awesome, some people give it hate, but I think its misplaced it really makes the tablet turn into the feel of a laptop and makes multitasking extremely seamless and easy. Only thing I dont like is no S pen support, I kind of wish I went with a 6 for that reason but didnt want to spend 650.
customer_reviews.author: FireMedic-GaFR

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Been using this tablet for a little while now I like it and having no WiFi issues Update 9/17/20 I use this tablet about every day and have no issues it works good I love this tablet
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Bad design flaw!
customer_reviews.text: There is a known design flaw that does not let you get on Wi-Fi or if you do it doesn't work in landscape mode. I returned this the next day. Got a Tab A 10.1 128GB. Same thing, but it gets on Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.author: Rustymine

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.... screen will not turn on.
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was delivered January 21, 2020 and work as expected. I was please with it until about two weeks ago when fully charged it would not turn on. I plugged it into the charger again and the battery indicator showed 100%. It will not turn on.... just a blank screen. I have no idea what to do but I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie May

customer_reviews.title: So far this is a great tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tablet so far. The touch screen works great, the colors are beautiful and the sound is amazing. Just for a test I played some Spotify music on it and I couldn't believe how nice the sound was. I had read another reviewer complain that there was no earphone jack. However, mine came with a converter from the USB port to a earphone jack. It works perfectly! It is incredibly thin so I would suggest you order a case right away. The battery life seems to be just as described.
customer_reviews.author: Knoxwell

customer_reviews.title: Better than the S6 Lite
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to choosing a tablet there are simply six relevant factors: (1) screen; (2) battery; (3) weight; (4) OS; (5) pen; (6) price. Pick your dealbreakers and your answer will be revealed. Apple aficionado? iPad or bust. Has to have a pen? Waste no further time on the S5e. Budget tablet? Grab a Fire HD 10 and don't look back. If, however, you value a truly exemplary 2560x1600 AMOLED screen, the lightest 400 gram tablet available anywhere in the iOS/Android tabletverse, and desire a standout battery and reasonable price, the S5E is it. I received mine a couple weeks ago and have barely been able to put it down since. For $350 this is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisP

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: So worth what I paid. The battery life is in pacable every day I've used it the battery has not gone below 70%. They did advertise a 14 and a 1/2 day screen time they We're not lying. Although everything is super great about it. The processor does lag a little bit. Takes a little longer to download apps then it does on my Galaxy S9 plus. But it is a really good tablet for watching YouTube Netflix prime streaming. I absolutely suggest you buy this for what the prices. Better than an iPad the iPad killer I say.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Dionysopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Samsung is trying to tell us the tablet days are over
customer_reviews.text: This is a very disappointing tablet for the reasons others have detailed. It can't hold a candle to the tab s3. Looks like we won't get a decent tablet again. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Best tablets made.
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat Samsung, best made and priced tablets out there. Lets me do everything I need to do from aardvarks to zzanzibars. I've been using Samsung for over 10 years and they are the best, easy to use, no blue screen of death, not over priced, just the BEST. 😛🤪🤪🧁
customer_reviews.author: Steven  Fragnito

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tablet I have ever owned The sound is fantastic, graphics are sharp and the response time is quick.
customer_reviews.author: EAGLE5789

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet That Takes Green Pictures!
customer_reviews.text: We got this tablet and then ordered a replacement because we thought we got a bad one...nope. Nice tablet and beautiful screen, but when you switch to picture app all the views have a greenish tint. And yes, if you take a picture it has a greenish tint. Both of the units we tried did this. Reset to factory settings and still does it. Cannot be corrected with the onboard color correction. Returned them both and got a Tab A. Not as nice a tablet, but it takes a normal picture. Very, Very, Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It was suppose to allow a USB flash drive to connect to transfee data but only USB connection is for charging, so disappointing as it costs as much as a laptop and does so much less. I had one 7 years ago that did as much functionally.
customer_reviews.author: E.M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Now this is a tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet. Fast with great video quality. Good for gaming with plenty of ram and storage. Best tablet I have owned yet, and the price is right. I couldn't see enough difference to justifying buying the pricey S6. For the money you can't go wrong with S5E.
customer_reviews.author: KS Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The S5e is a good tablet if you don't want to use the samsung pen technology. It's still a touch screen so it's not much of a loss. My wife loves it, especially since it's a little larger screen than my S3 tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D. Self

customer_reviews.title: Samsung failed on this tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is amazing but Samsung has not come up with a good fix for the wifi issues. If you block any of the corners the wifi just dies. Save your money and don't get this. Im still fighting with Samsung for a fix
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a tablet, but I thought it would be a waste of money. Now we fight over who gets to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is sleek, fast and great looking. Holds a long charge, easy to setup and use.
customer_reviews.author: P.E. C.

customer_reviews.title: Dead screen after 10 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in may 2019. Screen died Feb 27th 2020. Tried hard reset. Its a dead screen. No support from Samsung. Amazon says return window is closed. Goes without saying i am pretty teed off.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Worth to be a rival of Apple iPad
customer_reviews.text: I am using one of Samsung Galaxy smartphone series, and this pad is well paired with my phone! It has a big and clear screen and fascinating design. Light weight. It works well at YouTube, Google Chrome, etc. This pad well enables my blue-tooth keyboard to be paired. I'm not heavy game user, so I cannot tell anything with game play with this pad. Lastly, I am weighing a lot on storage enhancement. I paid for only 64GB not that big storage. But I can insert small card to increase total storage!
customer_reviews.author: Sungsik Kim

customer_reviews.title: huge upgrade for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm coming from a 3 year old tab. so keep that in mind. this is fast, thin and the screen is very clear. I was going to hold out for the next version, but this one is more than enough for me. I have no wifi problems. it's in a rubber case, the signal gets through.
customer_reviews.author: diydiy

customer_reviews.title: Easy access and expand ability.
customer_reviews.text: Like the memory can be expanded. Also have. 3 year old IPad Pro, this comes close and has some advantages. Can access all files directly and don’t have to use iTunes, which I hate.
customer_reviews.author: Alain Etcheberry

customer_reviews.title: Punches way above it's class
customer_reviews.text: Paper thin, fast, great screen. Same UI as Samsung flagship phones, powerful enough for running all browsing apps, this is my go to reading device. Battery lasts several days when reading~3 hours a day. Easy to hold for hours, I am always surprised how thin and light it is.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Ford

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet. I upgraded to this from my S2 and I am very pleased with it. It is very responsive and easy to set up and use. Updated to pie during set up which is great and all its features work well. Battery life is excellent and the 10.5 screen resolution is also excellent. Arrived in two days with prime I could not be happier with this product. I highly recommend this product and seller to others.
customer_reviews.author: Dave N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Display, Solid after Root & Bloatware Excision
customer_reviews.text: Great display, easy to use and fast. Samsung bloatware everywhere and a very complex path you root, but achievable. Few brands left in the tablet business, it’s pretty much Samsung or Apple. Replaced a Tab 2 that was dragging.
customer_reviews.author: mbon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get past setup
customer_reviews.text: Great screen feels nice to hold but I couldn't get pass the setup. Tablet gave me an error everytime I tried to log in to my google play account.
customer_reviews.author: ajklm

customer_reviews.title: Not a big admirer but a normal day to day use it's good.
customer_reviews.text: I hate it's wifi connection. It need extremely strong WiFi and it doesn't even show the wifi which my mobile phone shows. Everything other than that is awesome. But be careful if you have slow and weak wifi connection don't bother to buy it. It's completely sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Shishir Paudel

customer_reviews.title: More than what I expected😍
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dad as a gift. While setting it up, I was amazed by EVERYTHING...the screen size, the weight, the thin/thikness of the body, speaker quality, visual quality, extra memory slot. I'm definitely buying one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jun Salomon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to have a Samsung tablet again. Last year I purchased a Microsoft Surface Go. I should have returned it. I'm stubborn and was sure I could get used to it and like it. Not the case! I have a Samsung cell phone, TV and will always have a Samsung tablet. It was an expensive lesson. This tablet may be the best ever. Screen is very clear as is the sound. Battery is excellent. If able to, I'd give this tablet 5+.
customer_reviews.author: D. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Unevenly lit screen
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 5 different Tab S5e tablets and each one had various, but very noticeable unevenness in the display. More noticeable when displaying grey's at high-brightness or lower.
customer_reviews.author: nvllsvm

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth and keypad won’t stay connected.
customer_reviews.text: Bought and returned as screen froze within a minute. Second purchase, neither the Bluetooth or keypad stay connected for more than 30 seconds. Missed return window.. would not recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Samsung better than iPads
customer_reviews.text: It charges Really fast and I would say better that iPads . Way to go Samsung
customer_reviews.author: Andres loaiza

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Wife for Mother's Day. Can't believe how thin and light it is! It is super fast and the screen is amazing. Very happy with the purchase, should last her for years.
customer_reviews.author: tyler henderson

customer_reviews.title: Does not have S-Pen Support!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this by accident, thinking it had S-Pen support and had one included. This tablet DOES NOT HAVE S-PEN SUPPORT. If you're purchasing this with the idea that you can use it for writing notes or drawing, do not purchase this. Instead go after the S4 which is only marginally more expensive, comes with an S-Pen and actually has support for the pen. S5e is worse than the S4!
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Best budget gaming tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Is great budget tablet for play FPS mobile games. Actually I using it for play COD Mobile, PUBG and 9Inning Baseball everything run great. Right now I am running COD Mobile in medium graphics but I know it can be run on high graphics.
customer_reviews.author: HurricanePR

customer_reviews.title: Thin, Light, Fast and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Took me weeks doing research on tablets before getting this one. Love how thin and light it actually is. I bought the 6GB ram and have zero issues with lags or crashing during my daily usage. Batter life is more than impressive. I'm very happy with the quality of this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Coin Machine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tablet for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is mid range, and it works for me. I can not effort a high end tablet. This can play Fortnite in 30FPS. I love this Galaxy Tab. I got the 128GB silver, and looks great. I got a case with a built in screen protector, it is called SUPCASE.
customer_reviews.author: King Dimitrios

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great tablet. I'm a Samsung fan and owned several of the Galaxy phones over the years, and this device has lived up to the experience I've come to expect. I haven't gotten a chance to use the DEX feature yet, but I would highly recommend purchasing a protective case for it. I picked up a couple of cases (one "tough" case and one with a removable keyboard), and tend to use the "tough" case typically. I figure if I'm spending a few hundred dollars on the device, I might as well spent another $20-$30 to keep it safe.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: I love this tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet! My eyesight has been getting bad in recent years and I needed something larger then my phone. This definitely fit the bill. The screen and picture quality is amazing. Once everything was set up it's very easy to use. So pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet! I wish it was compatible with the S pen, but it does everything I want and then some. Super fast, great screen quality, fast charging, long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Truesdell

customer_reviews.title: After lots of comparing even with other Samsung models, it's a very good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight, thin and setup was very easy. Not a lot of bloatware like when you buy from retail outlets. 52 usable gigs out of the 64gb. Love the split screen it's one of the reasons I chose the S5e T720. Recommend to download free pdf of user manual to get the most from the device. Only 2nd day with it and you can type very well with the leg on screen keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: valerie washington

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Internet connection sucks on this thing
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this tablet is perfect except for the wifi. It constantly loses connection for me depending on how I hold it. Good thing that I got this to watch movies I've already downloaded. I would strongly advise anyone who wants to buy this to consider something else that works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Epic Gamer

product_meta.title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S5e 128GB WiFi Tablet Black (2019)
product_meta.description: Style:Tablet only| Size:128 GB| Color:Black| Configuration:WifiWeighing in at less than a pound, the incredibly slim Galaxy Tab S5e is perfect for your on-the-go life. Watch your favorite shows and movies come to life on a corner-to-corner 10. 5" Super AMOLED display. Plus, control lights, door locks, the thermostat and other connected home devices right from your tablet with SmartThings. It’s everything you need, all on a thin and light Tab S5e you’ll never want to put down.
feature_bullets: Ultra light for on the go; Lighter than a pound, our slimmest tablet won't add weight to your load; Stream, browse and more on eye catching metal design

Crisp; Clear; Captivating; Get drawn in to the 10; 5 inches Super AMOLED display with an immersive 16: 10 ratio widescreen; Shows and movies come to life in true to life color and crisp, clear details

Smartly connected; Control all your connected devices from your tablet; Adjust lights, control your TV, lock doors and even adjust the thermostat; Plus, get the details If you get a security camera alert
Charge Fast and go; Get up to 15 hours of video on a full charge and power up quickly with fast charging
Get 4 months of ad free YouTube and YouTube music with your Samsung Galaxy device

specifications.Wireless Type: 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,426 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
